node.title: French authorities investigate alleged rape of soldier at Elysee Palace
node.alt: a wide shot of the courtyard of the Elysee Palace at day time with the french flag on the roof
node.description: Both soldiers were stationed at the Elysee Palace, where French President Emmanuel Macron resides, but the accused man has since been moved away from his post.
node.content: ["French authorities are investigating allegations a soldier has been raped at\u00a0the presidential Elysee Palace.", "French President Emmanuel Macron's office said the woman had accused a fellow soldier of the offence.", "Both were stationed at the Elysee Palace, but the accused soldier had\u00a0since been moved away from his post, it said.", "The Paris prosecutor's office said the investigation was opened on July 12 and the accused man had\u00a0been questioned as an \"assisted witness\", a status meaning he was not interviewed as a suspect facing potential charges at this stage.", "The prosecutor's office did not provide further details.", "Mr Macron's office said it would not comment on a judicial investigation that was underway.", "But it said that as soon as the palace heard about the case, \"measures were immediately taken: listening, supporting and accompanying the victim\".", "It said officials are awaiting the findings of the judicial investigation before deciding whether other actions are needed.", "A French official\u00a0who was not authorised to be publicly named\u00a0said Defence Minister Florence Parly had launched an internal administrative investigation.", "The newspaper Liberation reported on Friday that the alleged attack took place after a farewell party for palace\u00a0staff members on July 1.", "The newspaper said Mr Macron attended the party but then left, and the alleged rape occurred later in a high-security building that was part of the presidential complex.", "Mr Macron resides at the palace.", "The revelation about the investigation comes amid growing efforts in France to fight and speak out against sexual violence.", "\"It shows that rape can happen anywhere, in any socio-economic environment, to anyone. Even in the most secure places,\" said Suzy Rotman, spokesperson for the Women's Rights Collective and founder of a French group for rape victims.", "The global #MeToo movement has encouraged more victims to report sexual violence in France, according to activist groups, but they remain in the minority.", "Seeking justice for rape \u2014\u00a0especially if the alleged perpetrator is a police or military officer \u2014\u00a0is a \"real battle\" because of the legal, political and emotional obstacles involved, Ms Rotman said.", "Tens of thousands of women have taken to the internet in recent weeks to share stories of being harassed or mistreated when filing sexual abuse complaints in France.", "The country has also seen a surge in recent online accusations of sexual misconduct in the media and theatre industries, following similar outpourings around alleged sexual wrongdoing by sports coaches and cultural figures.", "Ms Rotman called for special courts for sexual violence cases and more training for police in handling them.", "AP"]
